# end-to-end exploratory data analysis problem using Python and Tableau

The problem at broader level we wanted to analyze the economic and social data of countries in G20 group with API

**API:** an API or application programming interface is a set of rules that allow two pieces of software to communicate with each other in other words it's a way of one program access the data or functionality from other now the World Bank has an API that allows developers or analysts like us to receive data from various topics such as economics finance

https://wbdata.readthedocs.io/en/stable/\
https://github.com/OliverSherouse/wbdata\
https://blogs.worldbank.org/opendata/accessing-world-bank-data-apis-python-r-ruby-stata:

::: {.cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
# id: 5be44ff2

```

### Outlier Proportion

``` {.python .cell-code}
# id: c0ca6f0d
# id: c0ca6f0d
def outlier(x):
    q1=x.quantile(0.25)
    q3=x.quantile(0.75)
    iqr = q3 - q1
    return ( x < q1-1.5*iqr)  (x>q3+1.5*iqr)
```

``` {.python .cell-code}
# id: 47d5b117
# id: 47d5b117
def top_3(data, parameter):
    year_list = data['year'].dt.year.sort_values().unique()
    result_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=year_list,index=[1,2,3])
    
    for year in year_list:
        df_year = data[data['year'].dt.year == year]
        value = df_year.groupby('country')[parameter].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).head(3).index
        result_df[year] = value
    
    return result_df
```
